bibl.title: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, November 24, 1898

div1.p: Sternberg recommends that Agramonte proceed to Havana to study the cause and prevention of yellow fever. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, November 24, 1898
div1.opener:
Agramonte
Communications on official business should be addressed. “To the Surgeon General, U.S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Contract Surgeon.
In reply refer to No.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, November 24, 1898.
To the
ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to recommend that Contract Surgeon Aristi-
des Agramonte, U. S. Army, be directed to proceed from this city
to Havana, Cuba, for the purpose of pursuing his studies with re-
ference to the cause and prevention of yellow fever, under instruc-
tions from the Surgeon General of the Army, and under the immedi-
ate direction of the Chief Surgeon at Havana.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, Geo.M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
